Sentencas: Nanocrystalline acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide are synthesized by sol-gel method via hydrolysis process and evaluated for the suitability of applying as an electrolyte for the intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Phase purity and crystallite size of the synthesized materials are ascertained by powder X-ray diffraction studies.
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Introduction of Pr3+ ions in the cerium lattice exhibited a lower crystallite size than the Nb5+, which exposes the probability to attain high oxide ion conductivity of Pr3+ doped cerium oxide.
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Fourier transform infrared and Raman spectra confirm the functional groups and formation of Pr3+ and Nb5+ ions in the cerium lattice.
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Absorbance spectra exhibit the charge-transfer transition from O2- (2p) to Ce4+
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes
Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Pr3+ and Nb5+ ions doped cerium lattice create the oxygen vacancies and favor the formation of Ce3+ from Ce4+.
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Valence band transition of Ce3+ ions from the 5d to 4f levels are examined by photoluminescence studies.
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The morphological features of Ce-Pr-O and Ce-Nb-O are investigated by scanning and transmission electron microscopy.
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy is used to analyze the conductivity properties of solid electrolytes.
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Ce-Pr-O shows the high oxide ion conductivity of 0.1 S/cm at 600 A degrees C with an activation energy of 0.73 eV. Electrolytes with specific conductivities higher than 10(-2)
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: S/cm at intermediate temperatures (400-600 A degrees C) are required for solid oxide fuel cells to operate with less maintenance.
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Hence, Ce-Pr-O can be a suitable electrolyte material for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Investigations on acceptor (Pr3+) and donor (Nb5+) doped cerium oxide for the suitability of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes
